message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of guessing a secret vector transmitted through a noisy channel, which involves information theory (cs.IT) and cryptography (cs.CR). The randomized schemes described in the paper involve algorithms and probability theory, which fall under the categories of data structures (cs.DS) and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the penalty due to noise, which can be seen as a statistical inference problem, falling under the category of statistics (cs.SI).
